content:
**Which graph shows an exponential function with range $h(x) \geq 2$?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by two. A graph of a line intersects the points (negative 3, 2) and (1, negative 1).

choices.content: ![A ray of an exponential function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve has an arrow at the left edge and ends on the right side in a filled circle at (2, 0).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/39dcb58dfac8dea36f96eab768b752b5f31503d3)

![A ray of an exponential function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve has an arrow at the left edge and ends on the right side in an open, unfilled circle at (2, 0).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/52ae814f25c0de34608eac5ba79df7f49cb62511)

![A ray of an exponential function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve has an arrow at the right edge and ends on the left side in an open, unfilled circle at (2, 0).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/638bfebdce3dc8f82d73796f00db4addc2abe49c)

![A ray of an exponential function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve has an arrow at the right edge and ends on the left side in a filled circle at (2, 0).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5c5c85575167aca8e27245a1de07538b7b7e6128)
